description.value:
Sekelok makes three attacks with his greatsword or his shortbow.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage, plus [[/damage 2d6 type=slashing average=true]] damage if Sekelok has more than half of his total hit points remaining.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, plus [[/damage 2d6 type=piercing average=true]] damage if Sekelok has more than half of his total hit points remaining.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Indomitable (2/Day). Sekelok rerolls a failed saving throw.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). As a bonus action, Sekelok can regain [[/damage 20 type=heal average=false]] hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).

description.value:
Magic Resistance. Sekelok has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. Sekelok’s spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 13). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: animal friendship (snakes only), &Reference[poison]{poison} spray

3/day: suggestion

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Special Notes: snakes only.

This spell lets you convince a &Reference[beast]{beast} that you mean it no harm. Choose a &Reference[beast]{beast} that you can see within range. It must see and hear you. If the beast's &Reference[int]{Intelligence} is 4 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the &Reference[beast]{beast} must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by you for the spell's duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional &Reference[beast]{beast} for each slot level above 1st.

You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw or take 1d12 &Reference[poison]{poison} damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can't be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.
